subject: Travel
title: The Blitz and the Battle of Britain
description: A quick win: understand The Blitz and the Battle of Britain.

hook.text: In 1940, Germany sent 2,500 planes to bomb Britain into surrender. Britain had 749 fighters.

buildup.text: The Luftwaffe attacked airfields, radar stations, and factories day after day for months.

discovery.text: Britain's secret weapon was radar. Controllers could see German planes coming before they arrived.

twist.text: A German bomber accidentally hit London. Churchill retaliated by bombing Berlin. Hitler was furious.

climax.text: Hitler shifted to bombing cities. That gave British airfields time to recover and win the air war.

punchline.text: A mistake in targeting changed the outcome of the war.

quiz.question: What was Britain's key advantage in the Battle of Britain?
